import { useEffect, useState } from "react"; import Axios from "../axios.js"; const Form = () => { // To ensure that the data remains const [workouts, setWorkout] = useState([]); // We use useEffect because useEffect will be run at the very start and any time the dependency is changed. Therefore, all the data will be fetched at the very start. useEffect(() => { const fetchAllWorkout = async () => { try { const res = await Axios.get("http://localhost:3001/api"); setWorkout(res.data); } catch (err) { console.log(err); } }; fetchAllWorkout(); }, [workouts]); return (

Employee Details

Add Employee
{workouts.map((row) => { return ( ); })}
ID Workouts Load Reps Edit Delete
{row.id} {row.workout} {row.loads} {row.reps}
Click Confirm to delete
); }; export default Form;
